title: Cherry Bomb
description: Recurring dance party for queer women and friends. Features guest DJs and a vibrant atmosphere.
location: Typically at The Garrison or other venues, check listings
registrationDeadline: Tickets at door or advance for special events
activityDetails: DJ sets (various genres), dancing, social event for queer women and trans/non-binary folks.
website: (Search "Cherry Bomb Toronto" on Facebook or Instagram for current events)

title: Strapped
description: Inclusive, sex-positive QTBIPOC-centered dance party. Often features themes and performances.
location: Various venues, often The Garrison or larger spaces. Check listings.
registrationDeadline: Tickets often sell out, buy in advance
activityDetails: DJ sets (hip hop, R&B, dancehall, afrobeat), performances, body-positive atmosphere.

title: Drag Shows at The Drink, Crews & Tangos, Glad Day Bookshop, etc.
description: Various bars and venues in the Church-Wellesley Village and beyond host regular drag shows.
location: Church-Wellesley Village (e.g., The Drink, Crews & Tangos) and other venues
startDate: Weekly/multiple times a week at many venues
registrationDeadline: Often no cover or small cover at door; some special events ticketed
activityDetails: Drag performances by local queens (lip-sync, comedy, dance).

title: Inside Out Toronto LGBT Film Festival
description: Annual festival showcasing films by and about LGBTQ+ people. (Note: Main festival is typically May/June, but they have year-round programming/screenings)
location: TIFF Bell Lightbox and other venues
startDate: Main festival May/June; other screenings year-round
registrationDeadline: Festival passes/individual tickets on sale prior to festival
duration: Varies per film; festival spans ~11 days
activityDetails: Screenings of feature films, documentaries, shorts; Q&As with filmmakers; industry events.

title: Lavender Wild
description: One-day queer music and arts festival. (Inaugural event was June 2023, check for 2025 dates)
location: RBC Echo Beach or similar outdoor venue
activityDetails: Live music performances by LGBTQ+ artists and allies, art installations, community vendors.
travelTime: RBC Echo Beach is on Ontario Place grounds

location: Barbara Hall Park and other venues near The 519
activityDetails: DJ sets, live performances, community gatherings, large outdoor dance parties.

description: Produces contemporary opera and innovative music theatre, often with Canadian creators.

activityDetails: New opera works, experimental music theatre, workshops.

title: Factory Theatre
description: Hub for Canadian playwriting and theatre, developing and producing new Canadian plays.

title: Tarragon Theatre
description: Creates, develops and produces new Canadian plays, alongside contemporary international works.
activityDetails: New Canadian plays, contemporary theatre, readings.

title: The Assembly Theatre
description: Independent theatre venue supporting emerging artists and new works.
activityDetails: Indie theatre, comedy, improv, experimental performances.

description: LGBTQ+ bar with regular karaoke nights, drag shows, and other events.

description: Leather, denim, and uniform bar for men, with regular themed nights and events.

title: Oasis Aqualounge
description: Upscale spa and lounge for adventurous adults (sex-positive, clothing-optional environment). Hosts LGBTQ+ specific nights/events.
activityDetails: Pool, hot tub, sauna, social areas. LGBTQ+ nights provide a specific space.

title: Toronto Queer Market
description: Pop-up market featuring LGBTQ2S+ artisans, makers, and vendors.

title: Young People's Theatre (YPT)
description: Canada's largest and oldest professional theatre for young audiences.

title: Comedy Bar

title: Second City Toronto
description: Renowned improvisational and sketch comedy theatre and school.
activityDetails: Mainstage revues, touring company shows, improv sets, and workshops.
